Обязательно делайте по 3-4 разных сохранения, так как игра часто глючит, вылетает, квестовые нпс любят застревать в дверях/стенах.

Не пропускайте квест у ученых - он даёт лучший хазмат в игре.

Некоторые ворота глючат и открываются после перезапуска игры.
Фонарик включается на L.
Стрелять по врагам нужно в голову 1-2 выстрела, в броню 1-2 полных магазина не всегда пробивают.

185999275.review:
S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl es un shooter en primera persona con elementos de RPG y supervivencia, desarrollado por GSC Game World. Ambientado en una versión ficticia de la Zona de Exclusión de Chernóbil tras un segundo desastre nuclear, el juego nos pone en la piel de un "Stalker", un mercenario en busca de respuestas en un mundo hostil, repleto de anomalías, criaturas mutantes y facciones en constante conflicto.

Lo que hace especial a Shadow of Chernobyl es su atmósfera única: un entorno abierto y opresivo donde la exploración es clave y cada decisión puede marcar la diferencia entre la vida y la muerte. La IA de los enemigos y el sistema de simulación del mundo hacen que cada partida sea diferente, con combates intensos, gestión de recursos y una narrativa que se desarrolla a través de misiones y encuentros con otros personajes.

The atmosphere of the game is so good though. I played on Master difficulty and can not speak for what the other difficulties are like, but the intensity of being one shot if you miss a play is a fun mechanic to me. Cant wait to play the next two games and eventually the new S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2

185908608.review:
First time playing a STALKER game and to be completely honest I'm actually very disappointed.
It's not directly a bad game. There's just too many annoying things that kept me from enjoying the game.
I did make sure to install the ZRP mod and customized it's configuration, before starting my playthrough, but this still wasn't enough.

There are many mods available that can make this game a totally different experience, but I do think I should base my recommendation on the vanilla game itself. To find, download, install and configure mods from third-party websites takes extra time and effort, not to mention the potential risks.

So, do I recommend this game?
Generally NO, especially if you don't plan on installing any mods.
If however you do plan on installing and experimenting with mods, then sure, go for it!


GOOD
- Great atmosphere!
- Interesting open-world to explore.
- Combat is fun and intense (even though there still are many things wrong with it).
- Inventory system is relatively ok.
- AI is decent.
- Many mods available.

BAD
- Story is mediocre IMO.
- Too long dialogues! There's too much details and filler in the story that I really don't care about.
- Most of the dialogues are not voiced. If you don't have the patience to read long paragraphs in video games, then you will miss out on the story.
- The missions are not that exciting, especially the side-missions which are very same-ish.
- Anomalies can get very annoying! They're almost invisible and spread around the open world like minefields.
- Enemies are bullet sponges and the rifles are very inaccurate. This can to some extent be fixed with mods.
- Enemies are borderline cheating! It's almost like they have x-ray vision. You can be sneaking and hiding behind a huge rock at night and they still spot you. And when they do, they shoot at you with high precision shots, even from long distances.
- Enemies re-spawns way too quickly. Can be fixed by editing the configuration with the ZRP mod.

O que posso dizer dessa pedrada, um classico com uma ambientacao pica e graficos antigos mas que ainda assim passa a vibe e acrescenta pros dias de hoje, com a sensacao de solidao e perigo constante. Sendo o primeiro da franquia ele tem um mapa modesto mas bem detalhados, os modelos das armas,personagens sao ok  pra epoca, com varias faccoes. 
Jogo em si tem uma dificuldade alta ainda mais no comeco, mas explorando as areas e seguindo os caminhos nao tera tantos problemas.
Jogo tem 3 finais senao me engano ou talvez mais, com pequenas mudancas. sendo legal o arco final mas muito desbalanceado e com uma parte dando crash caso use quick save, frustando muito a gameplay.

resumindo recomendo demais o primeiro jogo, muito bom com uma historia foda, personagens enfadonhos de bom e uma ambientacao que te passa a vibe de um eslavo medio com uma vodka vencida.

185818323.review:
[h1]A Good Game from an Amazing Franchise[/h1]

Stalker has been one of my favorite franchises for a while now. From the original Book “Roadside Picnic”, the movie by Tarkovsky and the game trilogy (Still feels surreal to say this, but Tetralogy now) to inspired works like Metro, Into the Radius, etc. something about these Post-Apocalyptic media full of Soviet Nostalgia just hits the spot for me. 

As for Stalker SoC, perhaps the beginning of the modern Stalker franchise, I have mixed feelings. The game does a lot right, but it also does show its age in a lot of places that might be less than favorable. 
The overall story is good. Amazing for a game from 2007, but only okay when compared to modern games. It ties well into the lore and world it’s building, but I'd argue that almost all the standout plot points are taken from the book or movie (which is not a bad thing).
The Gameplay isn't anything to go crazy over either. Especially in terms of weapon accuracy for example, the game can feel very outdated which does get frustrating at times. That is the reason that my first 2 attempts at this game have ended somewhere near late-mid game. I just got bored or frustrated at some point and stopped playing.
The one thing this game does so incredibly well is the atmosphere. It really makes you feel like you are just another stalker in the zone. Every mutant or bandit can kill you, every anomaly you don't see will tear you to shreds. The difficulty is brutal and that is what makes the game so insanely engaging.

This game is responsible for creating my favorite genre of video games, so I can't really give it anything but respect and gratitude. Definitely something you should try out.

This is kind of off-topic, but my most recent playthrough (the first that actually went through to the end) was played on a modded version named Radiophobia 3. I really can't recommend it for a first playthrough since its insanely brutal on difficulty at times and really doesn't do any hand holding, but it does smooth over a lot of the flaws and improves the experience a lot. If you are a returning player, 100% give Radiophobia a try. Its easy to install and free.

185661067.review:
When this classic came out in 2007, the disaster of Chornobyl had happened just over 20 years ago. Now that this game is itself almost 20 years old, while a proper sequel has just been released to high acclaim, the original hasn't lost its fascination.

I'm not going to say this game is entirely without precedent, or inspiration. It came out in the same year as Far Cry 2, which travels in similarly hostile territory, but carves an entirely different path to the future. Half open-world simulation, half immersive-sim corridor shooter, STALKER tries to be a little too much, but seeps of atmosphere. Almost twenty years on, this is due to the pure craftsmanship as well as its failures and just as much to the mythology around production of this game. Notoriously buggy and ressource-demanding at launch, the game itself, the beautifully crafted locations and the complex systems running underneath proved engaging enough for people to push on and engage with the game, creating a massive modding scene, patiently tinkering to fix things or uncover new content in the source code, almost mirroring the stalkers exploring the zone to uncover its secrets.

It also mirrors STALKERS other inspirations, namely the Roadside Picnic book by the Strugatsky brothers and the more obvious Stalker movie by Andrei Tarkovsky (screenplay by Strugatsky brothers). The movie predates the Chornobyl disaster, and has its own ominously disastrous mythology, with the filmmaker, his wife and many of the film crew dying from the effects of industrial pollution on the film set. this is beautifully described [url=https://bldgblog.com/2010/05/ghosts-of-the-future-borrowing-architecture-from-the-zone-of-alienation/]here by Jim Rossignol formerly of Rock, Paper, Shotgun[/url].
https://bldgblog.com/2010/05/ghosts-of-the-future-borrowing-architecture-from-the-zone-of-alienation/

So while originally the charm of the game came from beautiful ideas strapped together like a malfunctioning nuclear reactor as if their lives depended on it, if you allow me this comparison, by now all that's needed is the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. Complete mod, which as a testament to the lively modding scene has gotten an update just before the release of S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2 (this is the last time I'm doing this) just late last year. I'm running the game on linux and it hasn't aged a day, still looks beautiful, especially the sky boxes and weather effects. The learning curve is steep, the game is challenging, but it's entirely up to the player how to play it, saving around every corner and hoarding loot, thus making difficulty just a matter of getting back into the mid-00's PC-game mentality.

185567528.review:
First, yes, you absolutely SHOULD play this game. If you're reading this here right now then that means you're obviously curious about it. I'll save you the mulling over it being old and eurojank. This game is absolutely worth your time, it is a PHENOMENAL experience and it still plays very well after all those years (even on vanilla). I bought this game because my friend recommended it to me in high school (a full decade ago lol) and it exceeded every expectation I had for it.

Now, for a warning. This has to do with the end of the game but I will try my best to explain this with little/no spoilers for anything plot related, because I really, REALLY wish I had know this before I played the game:

the last two/three levels of this game are an awful experience. They are unfairly difficult in a way that is not possible to predict and prepare for without knowing ahead of time what you are getting into. I won't go into the context of what's happening or where it is happening, but suffice to say you're fighting an ASSLOAD of enemies that can easily one shot you in a setting that will kill you just by standing in it to long. It is INSANELY EASY TO SOFTLOCK yourself into not being able to complete the game (happened to me TWICE meaning I had to redo about 8 hours of the game for BS reasons). Here's what you need to avoid that:

- you need a powerful weapon with a LOT of ammo. These enemies will gut you as soon as they turn their attention on you; the best option is to take them out BEFORE they have the opportunity to fight back. That means precision head-shots with a quality weapon (mid-tier assault rifles aint gonna cut it, I'm afraid).
- You need VERY good armor. Like I said before, the enemies hit harder than a dump truck here. If you want to stand even the most remote of chances, you need some strong armor. More importantly though you need armor (and artifacts as well) that have good stats against radiation, which brings us to the last suggestion....
- you need a metric FUCKTON of anti-rad kits and medkits. This is non-negotiable. The radiation in the final area of the game is SO ridiculously extreme that it is, by far, your biggest enemy, and by far the single biggest culprit in the game for softlocking people out of completing it. Even after killing/escaping every hostile enemy in the final area, the radiation will continue to get worse and worse and if you do NOT have the right equipment to fight it literally all the way up to the final cutscene, there is a very real risk you will soft lock yourself literally FEET AWAY FROM TRIGGERING THE END. It is BEYOND frustrating. Make sure, for god's sake, that you take the radiation threat seriously at the end of the game. Up to that point, radiation has been at worst a moderate threat in game, which luls you into a false sense of security and might make you not collect enough anti-rad artifacts and equipment throughout. This is a MASSIVE MISTAKE to make. You absolutely need them for the final area, you will NOT SURVIVE if you do not prepare for this. 

There, that's all you need to know to keep yourself from soft-locking yourself out of the end of the game. So long as you heed my advice and keep these points in mind for the end of the game, you should be golden. It's such a shame that the game ends on such a bullshit and unfair note like that, because evreything leading up to it is truly remarkable. But nevertheless, even with the terrible last few hours of the game, the vast majority of the game is incredible and definitely worth your time. Pick it up whenever you can, and good hunting, Stalker.

Just beat the game and man it is so good. The feeling you get when you step out in the real world for the first time, seeing the others stalkers playing music around the campfire, it is so immersive and just so well made. I also loved the diary and the encyclopedia system that they added, more games should have those things in it. I'd wish that there were more dialogue options because I really like the system that they use, it reminds me a lot of Morrowind. All in all, a gem, I'm already hooked into the series and feel obliged to buy the other games now. 
One last thing, as of now, I'm pretty trash on my russian skills but I was still able to understand some of the written signs across the game, so if you're learning russian that's just another reason to play this masterpiece.

185538646.review:
Açıkçası biraz zor bir oyun, ben en düşük zorlukta bile bir çok kez öldüm.

Şu ana kadar olumsuz düşüncelerim sizi ürkütmesin, çünkü oyun çok eğlenceli!
Özellikle savaş anları, ilk savaş görevinde Rıza baba ve ekibi ile birlikte mekan basmış, adamları indiriyoruz gibi hissettim.
Ve bir bölümde de 10 haydutu tek başıma indirdim.

Ama bir sorun daha, envanteri açınca oyun durmuyor, yani oyunda bir düşman sizi yaralarsa ve çatışmadaysanız ve tek başınıza iseniz işiniz zor.
Envanteri açayım sargı bezi veya medkit kullanayım derken düşmanınız size ateş edebiliyor, envanteri açınca oyun durmuyor yani.

Eğer ormanda bir bölgede hareket eden hava gibi bir şey görürseniz, onun içinde pek kalmayın, o şey radyasyonu ifade ediyor ve içinde çok uzun durursanız canınız gidiyor.
Ama görmez ve ormandan geçiyor iseniz fark etmenizin bir yolu var.
Bir anda ekranın beyazladığını ve " dıt dıt dıt dıııt dııııııt" gibi bir ses duyarsanız, orası radyoaktif bir bölgedir.

Sonuç:

Oyunu beğendim, zor olması da oyuna güzellik katıyor.Bir kaç grafik modu veya ultrada oynayıp yavan grafikleri birazda olsun iyileştirebilme imkanınız var.
İndirimin bitmesine 2 saat var, gözünüz kapalı alın derim size açıkçası.
Kötü bir bilgisayarınız var ise low veya medium da öyle böyle bir şekilde oynayabileceğiniz bir oyun.

Son:

İncelemem burada bitmiştir, okuyan herkese teşekkürler, hoşça kalın.

I have had this game in my library for years but had been put off by the slow, awkward opening couple hours.  With the 4th game in the series, STALKER 2, being released, I decided to finally go give this game a try.  I am glad I pushed past the awkward beginning because I honestly had a fun time.  This is quite a janky game, don't get me wrong, but the atmosphere is fantastic and it's got a feel that I really haven't experienced since the original F.E.A.R.

In short: play this if you're willing to put up with some jank and some dated decisions.

185523729.review:
This game is an, unexpectedly, detailed shooter for its time. The gameplay is great if you enjoy slow, loot-and-shoot type, with some horror aspect to it.

Since this is a very old game, there are lots of bugs and jank that you will encounter, so I suggest rebind the quick save to f5 , and quick load to f9, or somewhere familiar to press. I'm also glad my friend suggested a "ZRP" community patch to fix most of the common bugs in vanilla, so that there will be less headache later down the main story quest (MSQ). Since there are different progression paths, it's still a good idea to make hard saves every other MSQ completed, or before your quest giver gets himself killed, preventing you from receiving a reward.

Also, double-crouch and peaking buttons saved me from a lot of firefights.

185519191.review:
[h1] S.T.A.L.K.E.R: Shadow of Chernobyl – A Timeless Masterpiece [/h1]

I remember when I first played S.T.A.L.K.E.R: Shadow of Chernobyl. It wasn’t just a game—it was an escape. The ambience, the atmosphere, and the fantasy aspects drew me in completely. It was raw gaming, simple yet powerful, with its own unique aura that made it unforgettable.

Even now, replaying it years later, the magic hasn’t faded. The Zone’s haunting beauty, the oppressive skies, the tension of every encounter—it all feels as immersive as ever. It’s a testament to how much atmosphere can carry a game, even without modern complexities.

[b] 10/10. A timeless masterpiece that defined post-apocalyptic gaming. [/b]

与主流疯狂麦克斯式的废土完全相反，潜行者的世界更加冷峻与阴暗，消失在人们视野中的城市，遍布各种奇异现象，核事故导致的无人城市存在与普罗大众的想象中。
作为一款让人左右为难的一款游戏，起因是游戏中的问题层出不穷，很多不成熟的游戏设计让人非常不推荐。但游戏里的冒险路程惊魂动魄又让人十分推荐来尝试。如果你是想体验潜行者完整的故事历程，那么十分推荐这一款，前提是要能忍受游戏前期带来的空虚感，一旦进入故事主要流程中，游戏将会提速，之后的体验非常好。

185423915.review:
Багато не скажеш, навіть якби й хотів, бо гра вже доволі стара. Але темна і гнітюча атмосфера Зони всеодно відчувається.

Сюжет заплутаний і трохи спонтанний. Він нелінійний, проте від вибору майже нічого не змінюється. Тільки кінцівка. Але сама історія гарна. Побічні завдання доволі одноманітні: то притягни артефакт, то якусь важливу річ, то вбий когось, то зачисть мутантів.

Різних угрупувань багато. Їхня ідеологія суттєво відрізняється. В деяких вона навіть стала фанатичною. Одинаки ж переслідують власні цілі. Мутанти дуже серйозної загрози не представляють, з усіма можна справитись. Трошки проблемними були тільки кровососи і контролери. Гра проста, навіть на максимальній важкості. Помучитись доводилось тільки на початку, коли я тільки знайомився з грою і нічого не розумів, та в кінці, бо вороги ставали сильніші, а їх була величезна кількість. Гроші зароблялись легко та майже не витрачались, тільки зрідка на патрони.

Сильно несподобалась система перегрузу. Вона просто жахлива. Вага, яку можна переносити, дуже мала. Хоч деякі артефакти підвищують витривалість, але все одно треба постійно відхекуватись. 

Загалом, хоч реліз вже був дуже давно, та гра цілком іграбельна. Більшість часу грати було приємно. Деколи можна було навіть злякатись, бо з-за стіни в темряві хтось вискакував. Багів величезна кількість, але вони можуть іноді навіть розвеселити.

R. , Half-Life , Wolfenstein , Counter-Strike  , Battlefield , Arma , Brothers in Arms , Code of Honor , Killzone , Medal of Honor , Carnivores , Halo , GoldenEye 007 , Doom , Deus Ex , Delta Force , Carnivores; гравця закидають у пісочницю - Кордон (Застава) - свого роду передбанник Зони. Тут сталкери-новачки обживаються, знаходять перші цікаві місця та виконують завдання. Тут ми як маленька дитина, після втрати пам’яті, робимо перші кроки, кажімо перше слово, ага, так і повірили тут герой німий як риба, вполюємо першу дичину, жаль що їсти мутятинку не можна, знаходимо перши ствол і починається життя маліна, де перший костюм отримаємо. Де Сидор сто разів повторить свої слова, а ми будимо йому відповідати  у монітор. Ну, що змахнув олдскульну сльозу, біжимо далі по рецензії.  
[code]
Втомилися і підтоптались, 
І розуму таки набрались,

Ходімо в хату спочивать… 
[/code]
[h3] Так що собою являє місцина у цій чудовій грі: Зона — частина території Чорнобильської зони відчуження з підвищеною аномальною активністю. Але це звучить не цікаво та не романтично. Зона – це особливий часопростір, в якому кожний, хто входить, зустрічається із самим собою. По дорозі до центру Зони, подорожуючи ведуть діалоги і внутрішні монологи. Вони наче зазирають всередину себе, де бачать достойні речі і ті, що потребують переосмислення і виправлення. Але дуже важко побороти сумніви, важко побороти самих себе. Тому Зона створює легенди: герої та антигерої що увіковічили себе у розмовах та оповідках біля вогню, записах у старих КПК. [/h3]
[code]
— щастя для всіх задарма, і нехай ніхто не піде обділений.
[/code]
[b] Гра це багатогранний опус,  в кінці дізнаємося, чи правильно ми зрозуміли Зону(тому так багато кінцівок). Свобода, буде відчуватись у кожному кроці гравця. Кожна локація у грі майже позбавлена обмежень(пам’ятаємо про огорожі, рахуючи що за ними цікавого обмаль), що дозволить найдопитливішим сталкерам дослідити, мало не кожний куток запропонованого світу. Можливо навіть порадує хабар та знахідки. [/b] Серія STALKER мала глибокий вплив на українських геймерів та ширшу геймерську культуру в регіоні. Зображення Чорнобильської зони відчуження та теми виживання і стійкості глибоко резонують з українськими гравцями, відображаючи реальну історію та сучасні виклики. 
[h3] Серія не лише відображає страшні події минулого, а й демонструє незламний дух українського народу, який долає труднощі і не здається. [/h3]
[code]
Чого ти ждеш? Скажи — чого ти ждеш?
Кого ти виглядаєш з-перед світу?
Кого ти сподіваєшся зустріти,
а най і стрінеш — віри не доймеш?
Тамтого світу закуток глухий,
а в ньому жінка, здумана зігзиця,
шепоче спрагло: боже, най святиться,
о най святиться край проклятий мій.
[/code]
[hr][/hr]
STALKER також відомий активною спільнотою моддерів, яка розширила ігровий досвід через безліч модифікацій, додавши нові місії, зброю, ворогів та поліпшення графіки. Ця активність спільноти допомогла зберегти популярність гри навіть через багато років після її випуску, надихнули нове покоління українських розробників, сприяючи зростанню місцевої ігрової індустрії. Фанати організовують зустрічі, обговорюють новини та діляться своїми враженнями від ігор, що створює сильну і згуртовану спільноту. STALKER не тільки надихнув нове покоління геймерів, але й стимулював розвиток ігрової індустрії в Україні. Вплив серії відчутний у підвищенні інтересу до кар’єри в галузі відеоігор та у створенні нових, інноваційних проектів, які прагнуть досягти такого ж рівня впізнаваності та поваги.

185221323.review:
[h1] Un clásico inolvidable del survival FPS [/h1]
[b]★★★★★[/b]

Después de más de 15 horas explorando la Zona y completando la historia principal, puedo decir que S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl es una experiencia única y desafiante que vale cada segundo. Este juego combina de manera magistral acción, supervivencia y exploración en un mundo opresivo y lleno de misterio.

La atmósfera es el alma de este título. Desde los desolados paisajes de la Zona hasta los momentos de tensión en los laboratorios subterráneos, todo está diseñado para mantenerte alerta y comprometido. A pesar de haber desbloqueado solo 2 de los 7 finales posibles, siento que aún tengo mucho por descubrir, lo que habla de la profundidad y rejugabilidad del juego.

[h2]Aspectos destacados:[/h2]

[b]Historia atrapante:[/b] Cada misión principal y secundaria añade capas a la narrativa, haciendo que te preguntes constantemente quién eres y cuál es tu verdadero propósito en la Zona.
[b]Atmósfera inolvidable:[/b] El diseño de sonido, los entornos y los detalles hacen que te sientas parte de este mundo postapocalíptico.
[b]Desafío constante:[/b] Gestionar recursos, enfrentarte a enemigos humanos y mutantes, y evitar las anomalías hacen que cada enfrentamiento sea una prueba de estrategia.
[b]Rejugabilidad:[/b] Con múltiples finales y tantas posibilidades de exploración, siempre hay algo nuevo por experimentar.
[h2]Aspectos a mejorar:[/h2]

[b]Dificultad inicial:[/b] Los primeros momentos pueden ser brutales para los novatos, pero una vez que te adaptas, el juego recompensa la paciencia.
[b]Bugs ocasionales:[/b] Aunque no son frecuentes, algunos errores pueden sacarte de la inmersión.

En resumen, Shadow of Chernobyl es mucho más que un shooter; es una aventura que te desafía constantemente y que recompensa a los jugadores que se adentran en sus secretos. Si aún no lo has probado, no sabes lo que te estás perdiendo.

¿Listo para encontrar el verdadero corazón de la Zona?

185201827.review:
By far the best S.T.A.L.K.E.R., completely unmatched in terms of atmosphere and level design. 

While not perfect gameplay-wise, this game is an unique experience and a masterpiece of immersion that makes the player feel the helplessness of the Zone and a constant sense of dread and anxiety, especially in earlier missions and closed spaces. 

In the Zone, you will often see roaming NPCs camping or looking for artifacts/items, bandits looking for people to kill and rob, mutants looking for food and fights randomly breaking out between factions. Since most of NPCs activity isn't scripted, the Zone feels alive and makes the player part of it instead of being the catalyst for everything.

Without spoiling, I especially love the way more dangerous mutants are set up in the game when compared to later titles. It makes encountering them a lot scarier.
Fighting human enemies can be as difficult as fighting mutants since they approach fights differently based on their rank (more experienced enemies will use different strategies depending on the situation).

Despite its age and outdated mechanics, this game is still a 10/10 and would absolutely recommend it.

185139657.review:
[h1]This 18-year old game was ahead of its time[/h1]

FPS blended with stealth, survival horror and limited resources, open world, Post-apocalyptic, Inventory & financial management, sandbox-y side quests, decent story...[b]It is everything I ever wanted.[/b]

The atmosphere of the game was fantastic to say to least...the gloomy weather and colour tone, rusty old piles of metal junks and abandoned buildings, the bird chirps and howling winds give an uneasy feeling as they conceive the danger of the Zone. The beeping of rad meter and anomaly detector constantly keep the player on the edge. And the underground labs - dark, confined and quiet ([i]hopefully[/i]) - are simply nerve-racking.

The [i]S.T.A.L.K.E.R.[/i] series are commonly compared with the [i]Metro[/i] or the [i]Fallout[/i] Series in the "survival in a post-apocalyptic setting" sense. But another true appeal of this game lies in the inventory management and the open-world exploration. Another game play element of interest is that [b]there are unique variants of some standard weapons for players to find[/b]. This is a very motivating factor as they have improved characteristics compared to the standard ones, but are also extremely rare, requiring the player to obtain them through specific means (special missions, hard to reach places, hidden stashes and unique enemy) In these regards, I would like to mention another game (apart from [i]Fallout[/i]) that I thoroughly enjoyed: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/212010/Galaxy_on_Fire_2_Full_HD/][b] Galaxy on Fire 2[/b] by Fishlabs[/url], the inventory, trading and looting mechanism are spiritually similar in the two games.

Bear in mind SoC is an old game - so it might feel a bit rough on the edge in terms of graphics and GUI, but all in all it truly provides the purest old-school gaming vibe and pleasure: raw and unforgiving, down-to-earth and [b]solid[/b] game play.

If you would like a cherry on top - get the Zone Reclamation Project (ZRP) mod. It fixes various notorious bugs and add convenience to the game play, while keeping it authentic.

185120190.review:
Stalker: Shadow of Chernobyl was one of those games I could not wait to finish just so I could be done with it.
Atmosphere: B - The atmosphere was pretty good; it takes place around Chernobyl and the environments, characters, and audio-visual ambience matches that pretty well. In the credits it mentions the development team getting consultations from experts and it shows. This was the best part to the game.
Gameplay: D - The aiming system was way off. You can point right at something and for no reason at all the projectile goes flying in another direction. There are weird variances in weapon power as some weapons do almost nothing even at close range and others are pretty powerful (the pistol is just about useless and unfortunately your introduction to combat is with one which made it frustrating from the get-go). The controls aren't very intuitive and with no in-game guide to learning even though this was released in 2007, you have to go the extra mile to learn how to use everything. And forget about difficulty progression - by the end you are faced with extraordinarily difficult odds both with the enemies and environment which you did not have to worry much about prior - so if you didn't stock up on certain things beforehand you'll have to restore to an old game and do so or start over in order to finish it. That was the main reason why I didn't care to play through the different endings - I just wanted to finish it and move on.
Replayability: C - There is room for replayability and how many of the side missions you can take on, factions to help, etc. But due to the problems mentioned above there isn't much motivation to do so.
Story: D - Without giving away spoilers, the story is barely comprehensible. Even after watching a playthrough of the different endings it just didn't make any sense. The basic idea of Stalkers searching for artifacts in the Zone is a good one but beyond that there is a lot of head-scratching filler. 
Overall: D - I would only recommend this if you want to go through the Stalker series. If you're looking for an engaging, smooth FPS to play I would look elsewhere.

Що тут сказати, окрім того, що це база українського ігропрому. Насправді я ніколи не був фанатом Сталкера та й його фандом мене якось відштовхував, але з виходом другої частини, почав частенько натикатися на різний сталкерський контент, тож на знижках собі все таки і взяв стару трилогію, запустив першу частину та пірнув у гру з головою і чесно кажучи, ця гра може вас чимось вразити, незважаючи на свій вік.

  Наприклад з гарного, у грі є непоганий такий штучний інтелект. Вороги тут люті навіть на найпростішому рівні складності. Вони дуже люблять ховатись десь, а потім змінювати позицію, або нишком сидячи вилазити, щоб ви їх не помітили, а ще дуже швидко відбігають від гранат, тому у моменти коли закінчуються набої, ліки, або броня, то приходиться бути максимально обережним або взагалі покладатися на вдачу.

  Сюжет та історія зони інтригує. Під час проходження було дійсно цікаво перечитувати журнал, щоб більше дізнатися про головного героя, стрільця (._.), та інших персонажей, або локацій. АЛЕ, ось ближче до фіналу видно, що розробникам не вистачило сил, або часу реалізувати все до кінця. Деякі локації мають таємні двері, які нікуди не ведуть. Головний твіст - концептуально непоганий, але поданий він просто сирувато.

  По вайбу, Тінь Чорнобиля мені більше за все нагадало серію ігор Half Life і це непогано. Проходження може зайняти від 15 годин. Грав без фанатських патчів, тому багів зустрів звісно багато (десь візуальні, десь були й такі, через які не міг виконати певні квести). А так звісно РЕКОМЕНДУЮ, бо було і весело, і страшно, і душно, та найлоговніше - цікаво.

185093669.review:
The S.T.A.L.K.E.R. series is one that I have really gotten into, over the past year. It's excellent, honestly, I can't gush enough about the atmosphere and strange allure of the Zone. From an outsider's perspective, it looks like your standard FPS, but with a skin of eastern Europe and mutants. 

In that regard, their assessment is totally fair. However, the games hold a captivating presence that I just can't put down accurately into words. It's a mixture of vibes, atmosphere, tense environments, deadly combat, and compact but well designed world-building that all culminates into a compelling and unique series. 

I would highly recommend checking it out, the studio has worked themselves tirelessly through many trials to bring these games to us. It would be a shame for their work to be looked over. 

Now, the games are not perfect by any means, bugs and technical issues litter the franchise. Though these typically are not too invasive towards your experience, and criticism of these issues is completely valid. Though, I would suggest accounting for their experience as a smaller dev team, when addressing the technical issues with the games.

184843424.review:
I suppose it’s a blessing of sorts to not have money for new AAA games in December, for one thing it makes you take a cold hard look at your backlog. As much as I wanted to jump into Heart of Chornobyl at launch, despite its issues, I remembered that I never even tried Call of Pripyat. I bought it 12 and a half years ago. Why do we do this to ourselves? The modding community has done wonderful things to all three games in that time and yet, it’s always the new thing that gets our attention. I wanted to do better and I started with Shadow of Chernobyl. This was my second time playing it and of course I loved it, it’s still as good as I remembered. I installed Artistpavel’s recent Modern Update of the Complete mod released November 15, the timing of this release couldn’t have been more perfect. I was ready to enter the Zone.

I quickly remembered that a game with an inventory weight limit is not suitable for the hoarder lifestyle. I’m not a hoarder in real life, but something about video games brings out some sort of a trauma response, that if I don’t collect and sell everything, I will be broke by the time I get to the power plant. And the goal is what exactly, to open a diner for the weary traveler making their way to the Wish Granter? Looting everything you come across is just an insane response to a game’s economy and I’ve fallen for it every time. In this semi-comatose state we’re willing to haul a truckload of weapons on our backs to the nearest trader with unlimited funds and somehow convince ourselves that this is meant to be fun. Making money in the Zone is easy as pie, as long as you survive the journey. Mutant bits and artifacts should not be sold until Yantar and if you make several return trips there, you’ll be able to buy the armor and weapons you want. But you can also get a lot of that stuff by just exploring some life-threatening areas.

Everyone who isn’t shooting you is effectively a trader, most having enough funds to buy the trash you’ve managed to pick up. They don’t have any choice in the matter, they seem to want whatever you got and you have the final say. You can pick up the trash around an NPC and then sell it to said NPC. By revisiting open areas of commerce you will eventually find dead bodies with the 20 pistols you sold them. It’s a nice reminder that we take no riches with us when we die. I’m trying to impart some wisdom here, the game does not have vehicles or fast travel, the vanilla or Complete version, anyway. When you commit to finishing the final stretch of the game, you should only have useful things with you, not half a million with nothing to spend it on. The game also has many endings, so what is your goal as you reach the center of the Zone?

The object of mystery, the location itself, provides a rich soil for drama and suspense. We’re always captivated by places we’re not allowed to reach, like Area 51. The Chernobyl Exclusion Zone is a dark tourist attraction to this day and I bet most fans of this series would love to visit it in real life as well. From 1986 to 2065, when cleanup is scheduled to complete, it’ll continue to inspire people around the world. This is why the Wish Granter is a particularly clever addition to the story. I’ve only ever played the vanilla and Complete mod versions of it, so future playthroughs are opportunities for more intense survival horror as well as experience a lot of cut content restored in other mods. The devs are working on bringing the Legends of the Zone Trilogy updates to PC as well, which will include achievements. Both Shadow of Chernobyl and Call of Pripyat were recently included in GOG’s Preservation Program, so the series will remain in our hearts for years to come.

184781103.review:
"S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Тень Чернобыля" – ну чё, братва, слушайте сюда!

Эта игра – просто пушка-гонка, базарю. Тут тебе и перестрелки, и хабары, и мутанты, от которых жутко, как будто тебе кабан в подвале дорогу перегородил. Зона, короче, реально живая – чувствуешь себя своим, а иногда и последним лохом, если на аномалию нарвёшься.

Графон: да какой там графон, не 2015-й год же. Но всё равно, красиво, особенно закаты – это когда ты живой, а не когда кровосос тебя на органы разобрал.

Сюжет: вот это реально по кайфу. Сначала нихрена не понятно, что делать, куда идти, кого валить, но потом втягиваешься. Хабара набрал, на базаре барыгам впарил – и гуляешь по Зоне, как хозяин жизни. Ну, или пока тебя бандиты в тёмной подворотне не встретили – они тут серьёзные ребята.

Геймплей: тут уже, брат, кто как привык. Хочешь – ползи, хочешь – всех подряд лупи, но лучше, конечно, шухериться. Зона ошибок не прощает – только сталкеров хоронит.

Мутанты: во, вот тут прям ору. Эти кабаны, псевдопсы и кровососы – хуже налоговой. В кустах сидят, ждут, пока ты расслабишься, а потом – бац, и всё, хана. Ну, зато прикольно, адреналин так и прет.

Легенды Зоны: то тебе скажут, что на Кордоне чувак в экзоскелете ходит, то расскажут про тайник на Агропроме. Ну, как водится, за каждым поворотом новая история.

Итог таков, братва: "S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Тень Чернобыля" – это как в Зоне побывать, только живым остаться. Если не играл, то ты не сталкер, а просто турист. Давай, бегом в Зону, артефакт сам себя не найдёт!

184729153.review:
Despite it being nearly 20 years old upon replaying it this game has blown me away once again. There are so many aspects of this game that makes it such a fantastic game and truly worth the price. For me there were 5 main aspects of the game i loved.

The gunplay, the gunplay in this game is really hit or miss for some but for me i really loved the dated old CSGO source feel of the guns. The accuracy is incredibly inconsistant but when you do manage to hit a headshot in one bullet it feels amazing. The guns all feel very different to eachother, finding ammo on bodies is also extremely easy making the game more fluid and not having to stop by traders every 30 minutes like i seems in STALKER 2.

The level design, despite the level based system where you have to go through loading screens which i find tedious (It makes sense for a game from 2007) The levels within each of the areas are incredibly immersive and i feel like each level brings its own level of intensity especially with the later areas and the underground labs like X16 and X18 and the secret lab. Pripyat was by far my favourite level. Incredibly well designed level and a eerie feeling which made me feel infinitely more immersed. Each level feels intricately designed and made with personality.

The NPC's and encounters across the zone each feel different from the other and the NPC's feel weirdly familiar, it also obviously introduces characters that will be preveleant throughout the entire series such as:

Sidorovich 
The Doctor
Strelok
Sakharov
And General Krylov

The story in this game is absolutely fantastic (Spoiler ahead) [spoiler] With the character first beginning the game it starts with a truck which is later known as a death truck bringing back stalkers from the heart of the chernobyl NPP. The truck crashes and scavengers find a barely alive individual. This sole survivor was brought to the trader Sidorovich, the survivor is given the nickname "The marked one" As per the tattoo on his arm being "S.T.A.L.K.E.R. The marked one has no recollection of who he is or how he had ended up in the zone. His only clue was a cryptic message on his PDA reading: "Kill strelok" and this sets up the premise of the story for the next 70% of the game where he finds clues and talks to NPCS of the zone to find strelok. It is later revealed through The doctor who strelok knew when before he had forgotten his past due to amnesia reminded him of the secret of the monolith in the heart of the sarcophagus.

The plot twist in the story being the fact the main character we play as is actually revealed to be strelok. And the wish granter in the sarcophagus was actually a decoy to hide the real secret of the monolith being the C-Consciousness. However to first get there strelok needs to disable the measures put in place by the C-Consciousness. These are the brain scorcher and the PSI device in the underground lab. Once these were turned off it gave way to pripyat and beyond. upon reaching the sarcophagus strelok begins hearing the wish granter which calls to strelok saying things to try lure him to the wish granter and deny him the true endings. once strelok reaches the secret lab he finally meets the C-Consciousness which reveals that strelok has once tried to reach the sarcophagus before but they had preventing him from doing so and turned him into an agent which is why he has the tattoo of S.T.A.L.K.E.R on his arm. Among other things revealed. And then strelok is then faced with the decision of joining them or not.  [/spoiler]
 
 [spoiler] Lastly the endings. the game offers 7 different endings however 5 of these 7 being often considered "False" endings and not true endings as it results in strelok going into the wish granter and wishing for something but the wish granter instead of granting streloks wishes. however the wish granter instead twists his wishes and all 5 of the endings offered are incredibly miserable and very unfulfilling. 

However the two true endings (one being canon) involves strelok either joining the C-Consciousness or putting an end to it altogether and fighting through more monolithian forces to kill the 7 original scientists and shooting their pods. Finally breaking the zones true secret.  [/spoiler]

The game is absolutely fantastic and was well worth the money considering it was apart of a bundle on sale for an extremely cheap price i would recommend this game to anybody wanting a story game but on the shorter side.

Первая часть в серии но не первая часть в хронологии событий, Тень Чернобыля, потрясающая игра которая хороша в многом но так же и во многом отстаёт, особенно если играть с начала в "Чистое небо", а потом в эту, у игры есть недостатки но они прощаются по тому что игра первая в серии, и она запускалась как пробный проект понравится ли людям, о ней можно много что сказать, не знаю как она ощущалась в самый момент выхода в 2007 году (мне был 1 год) но даже когда я её попробовал в году примерно 2015, она для меня казалась очень страшной, такой что я сколько раз пытался пройти, всё не получалось и я забивал просто по тому что ссал пройти лаборатории, по этому собрал яица в кулак и прошёл игру я в первый раз в 2017 примерно, и она не настолько понравилась что я её стабильно проходил раз в год, вместе с остальными частями "ЧН и ЗП", по этому эта игра и вся эта серия это одна из тех игр и серий что произвели на меня большое влияние и я советую всем пройти хотя бы раз всю серию игр.
Сюжет 9.6\10 (он для меня и в правду крутой, он намного лучше чем сюжет "ЧС и ЗП" это сто процентов, лично для меня хотя бы по тому что он не такой простой к в следующих частях, и при этом достаточно интересный, ты действительно чувствуешь себя главным героем, а не тем кто просто догоняет человека по тому что если не догонит то умрёт, а тут действительно интересный сюжет даже с  интересными поворотами и интересными Доп. заданиями)
Графика 6.3\10 (не совсем дно конечно, но графика прям хромала в этой части, тем более если с разницей в год вышла "ЧН" которое было на 3 головы выше по графике, но делая скидку на то что эта игра была пробником во всей серии, я считаю её приемлимой)
Локации 7.5\10 (они достаточно хороши, и интересны каждая по своему так что оно того стоит, интересно по ним ходить и смотреть по сторонам, и этого достаточно) 
Музыка\Звуки 9\10 (они шикарны как и в остальных играх этой серии)
Атмосфера 10\10 (она прекрасна, это лучшая атмосфера локального пост апокалипсиса из всех которых я видел, каждый звук, каждый разговор, каждая локация, каждый Бандит, Монстр, и тд., пугает тебя и тебе интересно и страшно проходить игру, я даже сейчас проходя игру, немного подсыкнул в лабораториях, и подземках, персонажи запоминаются, даже не основные, такие как зам Волка, Волк, Шульга, Боров, и тд.)
Физика 6.3\10 (вот где игра подвсосала так это в физике, очень криво летят пул, их разброс не объясним ничем, так же как и не возможность запрыгнуть на выступ по колено, но физика это проблема всех Сталкеров)
Оружие 7.9\10 (его много, оно интересное, они ощущаются разными, немного можно снизить то что когда стреляешь, оно ощущается не всегда таким каким ты ожидаешь его чувствовать из за этого бешеного разброса пуль, но в остальном ты чувствуешь оружие отлично) 
Персонажи 8.9\10 (каждый пресонаж это не просто пресонаж, а отдельная личность со своей историей и с своими проблемами, со своими заслугами и со своим характером, их интересно слушать, с ними интересно говорить, и расспрашивать разное, даже у простых новичков на каждой локации интересно спрашивать "Что нового в зоне?",каждый ответ прописан и совпадает с характером пресонажа)
Общая оценка 8.7\10
Эта игра просто потрясающая хотя она и имеет несколько минусов, таких как огромный разброс пуль, который не вяжется нес чем, отсутствие техников что тоже очень влияет на игру, так как починить костюм ты не можешь починить оружие так же, никаким образом разве что кроме "5 батареек и электро аномалии" 
но это не совсем то что ты ожидаешь тем более в игре всего на все локации 5 батареек, так же минусом является то как ты ищешь эти артефакты, они просто валяются на каждом углу, на каждой поляне, я мог собрать в одном туннеле\поляне штук 6-7 артефактов, это не очень влияет на атмосферу, я считаю ЧН в этом плане та и во многих других в 10000 раз лучше, если не брать сюжет, а брать только техническую часть игры, то ЗП я считаю одной из лучших в серии, но в общей оценке они ниже,, так же минус который потом перейдёт в ЧН это тайники которые ты находишь и можешь открыть в открытом мире и но они пустые, и только после получения информации от кого то, ты можешь получить от туда предметы, но в отальном игра шикарна, мне она нравится, её плюсы перебивают её минусы, я её очень рекомендую к прохождению каждому человеку.

Ich habe es mit einer aktuellen Version der Mod "Stalker Complete" (Vers. 1.5.2) und bin beeindruckt, wie gut es dem Team gelungen ist, den Stil in die Moderne zu holen. Gleichzeitig fühlt es sich aber auch nach dem Original an.

Und es zeigt einem bis zum Ende immer wieder neue Dinge und es ist auch 2025 noch immer ein sehr gutes Spiel. Die Atmosphäre ist noch immer super, das Weltdesign faszinierend und die Story deutlich tiefer, als es zu Beginn den Anschein hat.

Und das Finale des Spiels ist ebenfalls fantastisch. Es ist ein großartiges Spiel!

Wirklich großartig.

184356065.review:
S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl – это не просто шутер от первого лица, а мрачное и атмосферное погружение в постапокалиптическую Ззону Отчуждения, полную аномалий, мутантов и загадок. Это игра, которая вышла за рамки обычного экшена, став культовой благодаря своей уникальной атмосфере и нелинейному геймплею. S.T.A.L.K.E.R. - это суровая реальность выживания, где каждый выбор имеет значение.

Сильные стороны:

+Уникальная атмосфера: Зона, созданная в S.T.A.L.K.E.R., буквально пропитана тревогой и безысходностью. Заброшенные деревни, радиоактивные болота, мрачные подземелья и аномальные поля создают неповторимое чувство присутствия в опасном и непредсказуемом мире.
+Нелинейность геймплея: Игрок волен выбирать свой путь, исследовать мир, выполнять задания различных группировок или же просто зарабатывать деньги, продавая артефакты. Такая свобода действий делает каждое прохождение уникальным и интересным.
+Интеллектуальные противники: Мутанты и сталкеры, населяющие зону, ведут себя достаточно реалистично. Они реагируют на действия игрока, используют укрытия и тактику, что делает сражения динамичными и напряженными.
+Сложная система выживания: Помимо сражений, игроку приходится следить за уровнем радиации, голодом, состоянием снаряжения и медикаментов. Эта система добавляет реализма и заставляет постоянно быть начеку.

Слабые стороны:

-Технические недоработки: Несмотря на свою атмосферность, игра на момент выхода страдала от множества багов и технических проблем, которые, впрочем, частично исправлялись фанатскими патчами.
-Сложность для новичков: Отсутствие четких подсказок и высокая сложность могут отпугнуть неподготовленных игроков. Нужно быть готовым к частым смертям и необходимости разбираться в механиках игры самостоятельно.
-Не самый выразительный сюжет: Основная сюжетная линия, хоть и имеет свои интересные моменты, все же не является сильной стороной игры и часто отступает на второй план из-за свободной формы повествования.

Заключение:

S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl - это игра, которая западает в душу своей атмосферой, сложностью и непредсказуемостью. Она не лишена недостатков, но ее уникальный геймплей и мрачный мир способны затянуть на десятки часов. Это игра, в которой выживание не просто слово, а ежедневная борьба, требующая от игрока смекалки, осторожности и готовности к непредсказуемым ситуациям. Несмотря на технические недоработки, S.T.A.L.K.E.R. остается одной из самых запоминающихся игр, которая определила целое направление в жанре и продолжает привлекать игроков своей уникальностью и глубиной. Она оставляет после себя горьковатое послевкусие, которое не отпускает долгое время, заставляя возвращаться в Зону снова и снова. Это игра, которую не просто играешь, а переживаешь.

184247165.review:
[h1] Тень Ностальгии[/h1]

Первый сталкер, на мой взгляд скорее получился комом, чем блином и на это много намеков, но этот ком остался хотя бы вкусным, ведь несмотря на некоторые баги с окружением и квестовыми персонажами, вылеты почти каждые полтора часа и просто ощущением что я играл в первый half life, но с небольшими косметическими улучшениями из 2007 года, все ровно как все и говорят в игре осталась та самая душа и атмосфера.

Говоря о ней, все уже давно успели посидеть у костра, послушать анекдоты и примкнуть к хардбасс движению, но все же даже сейчас вернутся и послушать это все довольно лампово, разработчики скажем так многое запороли и не доделали, но все таки суметь атмосферу смогли.
Также сделав вполне себе неплохой сюжет, хоть и простой да короткий, но ведущий на удивление к разнообразным концовкам, если пойти по другому пути, дав завязку на продолжение.
Ну и конечно ещё из плюсов это живой мир, где ты может и одинокий сталкер, но всяких разборок мутантов с бандитами и просто перестрелок, достаточно чтобы поверить.

А вот из минусов и скорее жирных, это как я и писал выше, ощущение что я играю в игру прямиком из 20 века, ведь текстуры мыльные, анимации далеко не ушли,  а кривущий ИИ хоть и живой но С#ка тупой и почти все перестрелки в игре превращаются что тебя то ли в плотную не видят, то ли со ста метров чуть ли не через стену убивают прямой очередью в голову, из за чего перестрелки я здесь не любил вместе с кривящей точностью оружия и в итоге стараешься обходить всех болванчиков.

Но все таки игра подарила спорное, но скорее позитивное впечатление, хоть по сути игра и состоит из недоработок, что под конец я конкретно так задушился от вечных перестрелок и продолжал на святом духе. Всё же советую к ознакомлению.

184211520.review:
[i]"I said come in, don't just stand there."[/i]

It's been over a decade since I last played this clunky, buggy gem, and it's some of the most fun I've had in a while. Since S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2 came out, it was time to re-experience the OG before giving the newcomer a shot.

I played the unofficial patch version, so I'm uncertain how the Steam version holds up today. You can pick it up from here: https://www.pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/S.T.A.L.K.E.R.:_Shadow_of_Chernobyl

[b]New Players:[/b]
S.T.A.L.K.E.R. - Shadow of Chernobyl, is a semi-open world, FPS that's set in Ukraine in an area known as The Zone, which is the radiation affected area near the 1986 Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant Disaster. You play as The Marked One, who seems to be among many other individuals known as Stalkers, who venture into The Zone to retrieve valuable artifacts for sale. The world is full of mutated animals, rival Stalkers, bandits and factions fighting for their own gain. Your past is unknown, but your missions is straight-forward... find and kill Strelok.

[b]Review:[/b]
When I first played this game back in 2007, I had tremendous trouble getting into it. It was nothing like I experienced before, especially since the game gave little to no indication of what you had to do, other than the missions you obtained. I gave up shortly after starting, but after seeing a friend progress and just how much fun it appeared, I knew I had to retry and push a bit further, while also exercising some patience with this clunky system. It was among the best decisions I made in my gaming history and I soon fell in love with the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. series, followed by delving into the mystery of the 1986 disaster itself. The game is one of the best from the early 2000's

[b]Gameplay:[/b]
Things kick off like most FPS games do. You start off with weak equipment / weapons and gradually improve it as the story progresses. What made S.T.A.L.K.E.R. different was that added some RPG elements, instead of your typical run and gun shooters, almost like an Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion theme. This meant that you had a variety of equipment ranging from armor, to weapons and consumables that contribute weight onto your pack, but also increases resistances to the various damage you can receive, and also the stats on your weapons.

At first I couldn't stand the gun play. I was used to aiming for the head and hitting headshots, while in this game you could empty a magazine and not hit a single shot at times. Aiming down sights helps in this matter, even with guns that have the lowest of accuracy, but this was the mechanic that drove me to quit the first time. It gets better with different guns, but my best advice is to take breath and just learn the game. It really becomes better the more you progress.

There are a bunch of factions in the game, with the two main ones being Duty and Freedom. I'm uncertain if you can join some of the others, but joining a faction is also optional. In this play through, I chose to just focus on the main mission, but for a more engaging experience, you should try joining a faction.

The map appears massive, but honestly, it just big enough in my opinion. There are plenty of places to explore, with opportunity to do missions, earn money, obtain loot and find artifacts that can be used or sold. At first, you'll be spending a lot of time running between traders to sell your gear for money, but eventually, with the proper artifacts, you'll be zooming all over the map on full sprint.

[b]Graphics:[/b]
Yeah... it's pretty dated. Even back then, the graphics were questionable and definitely not eye-candy. That being said, it's weirdly charming, especially because of that eerie feeling the world constantly provides. The sun never truly shines. It's always dark, cloudy and depressing, which really adds to the immersion of the game. Gun models are a bit too big at times, but at least you get used to it.

[b]Story:[/b]
This was another turn off at first, because you're really left with very little when the game kicks off. BUT... I'm glad I saw the error of my ways since the story is actually pretty good.

You're found among the bodies of a Death Truck and seem to suffer from severe amnesia. Since your identity is unknown, you're giving the moniker Marked One. Your PDA shows that you have a single goal, which is to find and kill Strelok. Who or where he is, is uncertain, but there are some traders and Stalkers who're willing to help you, for a price of course.

[b]Conclusion:[/b]
It's old and dated, but surprisingly, the game still holds well. I'll be jumping into the expansions right after this and gradually make my way to the sequel. It's a resounding yes, that you should pick up this game, but keep an open-mind when playing, it's not your typical FPS.

184059200.review:
It's kind of funny how ever after all of my runs in this game, all of the mod experiences, all of it, I never got around to reviewing this game.

I remember back when I first played it, and then later returned to it, I told myself I would rack up more hours, experience more in the game and then ultimately leave a shining review of the franchise.

Over the years, life got ahead of me and I never returned to review this title.

Having said that, at the time of when I was going to review it, the game was not nearly as popular as it is now. Anomaly didn't exist, Call of Chernobyl wasn't a thing, and Misery had just barely been released. Let's not even get into GAMMA, as that wasn't even a blip on the radar.

Over the last decade, it's honestly exploded in popularity, and it's no surprise. Games like Tarkov tried their best to emulate what STALKER worked ever so hard to cultivate. And even after all the years passed, nothing has really ever held a candle to this franchise - not even the Metro series (which is also excellent in it's own right).

All of this to say, STALKER: Shadow of Chernobyl was one of the greatest gaming experiences I ever had nearly a decade ago. All of the playthroughs with various mod packs, and being part of the community as it's grown immensely in numbers has been a sight to behold. I said it WAS, and to be fair, it really still IS one of the greatest.

I look back on this game, and the trilogy very fondly. Returning to them at various points in time, and having some of the most fun I've ever had in a survival / single player / horror / FPS / whatever you want to call it type of game.

I never imagined this series would leave such an imprint on me. From the days of watching the trailer for it and not knowing what to expect, to the moments of entering an underground poorly illuminated laboratory for the very first time and feeling completely unnerved - nothing will ever replicate that experience.

While the game and it's mechanics may not have really aged that well, they also didn't age too poorly. Download a mod or two for the graphics, maybe some for the mechanics, or just go for something like Complete Mod (the newest version btw), or Radiophobia 3. If you're experiencing it for the first time, try to avoid mods that will change the vanilla game experience too much.

Other than that, enjoy your experience, because you can only go through this for the first time once.

Good hunting, STALKER.

183956472.review:
Mais um daqueles jogos que dão gosto de jogar.
 
Depois de assistir aos trailers do novo jogo da saga, S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart of Chornobyl, decidi dar uma chance para a série e devo dizer que fui surpreendido. Como sendo o primeiro da franquia ele é bem antigo, tendo sido lançado em 2007, com gráficos que podem incomodar aqueles que estão acostumados com jogos mais novos e gráficos realistas. Contudo, não deixe que isso te pare, o jogo é extremamente completo até mesmo para os dias de hoje, com uma história envolvente e uma gameplay tática e difícil que requer planejamento do jogador antes das missões e combates, tendo inspirado outros jogos como Escape from Tarkov. Além disso, devo dizer que os pontos altos do jogo são sua atmosfera, que realmente consegue passar a desolação e mistério remetentes da zona de exclusão de Chernobyl, bem como sua IA com o sistema A-Life, que tenta simular a vida dos personagens na zona e proporcionar mais dificuldade para os combates. com NPCs que realmente dão um certo trabalho.

Sumarizando, S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl é um ótimo que merece uma chance, pois mesmo sendo datado, consegue se manter relevante nos dias de hoje tanto pela sua qualidade, sendo melhor que muitos FPSs da atualidade, tanto pela sua comunidade ativa, que revitalizou o jogo com mods como Anomaly e Gamma que simplesmente o transformam, sendo atualizados até hoje.

183939114.review:
[i]"Come to me. You will get what you deserve."[/i] 
- The Wishgranter

[b]This is a mixed Review.[/b]

For starters, the acronym for S.T.A.L.K.E.R. stands for [i]"Scavengers, Trespassers, Adventurers, Loners, Killers, Explorers, Robbers"[/i]. These are the kind of figures you'll find in and near the mysterious [i]Zone[/i], looking for fortune and opportunity alike, and nigh indistinguishable in look. Hence, if you're here, you're taken as one of such S.T.A.L.K.E.R.s, and as such, you're also welcome to get out.

Ambitiously dropping in 2007, this game righteously gathered a cult following; a pseudo open-world with some RPG elements, [i]S.T.A.L.K.E.R. Shadow of Chernobyl[/i] (STALKER SOC) landed with a very strong art direction and loaded with several mechanics to take into consideration. However, ambitious as it was, [i]SOC [/i] is a prodigy child that may as well have been dropped on its head - It does a lot of technical things, but none of them particularly well. And back in the day, when doing anything at all was considered a lot, it's safe to say this game earned its place as a classic.

This will be an overview of the Vanilla experience, so I urge you to come in. Don't just stand there.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

[i]STALKER: SOC [/i] stands tall as a classic by its mysteriously daunting experience. Many of its fans never understood, or bothered to understand, its difficulty system. That is because the staple [i]sentiment[/i] of the SOC's gameplay pertains to being continuously heeled in the face; by the non playable characters (NPCs), by the environment, by your equipment, by the narrative, by your luck. This frankly happens in any difficulty, as environmental anomalies are deadly and enemies are bullet sponges no matter what; most weapons are pea shooters and any non-headshot damage is almost negligible. The biggest modifier for difficulty is in fact the loot drop table, and I have not noticed any further enjoyment from having this culled in the more difficult modes, so I recommend the easier ones for the first playthrough.

You do not level up in this game, but rather acquire or scavenge new equipment, and come across anomalous artifacts which are, well, anomalously produced by the Zone as you explore it. These give you different stats when equipped. If you perform side quests, it's usually for the money, which quite frankly doesn't have much of a use. Even on lower difficulties, you won't be able to afford anything interesting without grinding, and if still you do, its durability will deteriorate much faster than you can afford to buy a new one of whatever it is; you can't ordinarily repair anything.

As an RPG, the game features a continuously running open-world "simulation" where NPCs go around being their S.T.A.L.K.E.R. selves; that is, looting, wandering, killing each other, ganging up, profiteering, all without your observation or input. I believe SOC invented the concept of "radiant quests", where traders and NPCs will continuously produce fetch and elimination quests for you to farm with. That is, if farming was a good idea in a game with equipment condition and no level ups.

While its simulation aspect is interesting, it is the epitome of jank; often NPCs will complete elimination quests for you by the sheer fact they are trying to stay alive in the affected area, or story critical NPCs roaming about will be [i]Lost to the Zone[/i] by random crap happening, locking you out of your own story and forcing you to reload a save. The biggest advice veteran stalkers will give you for this game, is indeed to save often and load again.

As a FPS, the game provides some enjoyment with a large arsenal, binocular scouting identification system, multiple movement options, special weapon mods, ammo types, and NPC tactics. Unfortunately the detection mechanics are often janked which make most of these redundant, so in Vanilla you're playing a linear hallway shooter for half the game. SOC's hallways will intensify and comically turn into a monolithic experience the deeper you get in the Zone, as its RPG open world design falls completely apart. It is not its selling point in the slightest. 

Some suggest there are also countless bugs; my most recent playthrough only had up to 2 crashes. But I also saved a lot, and often loaded on reaction, so if something [i]really bad[/i] happened, then well it didn't happen!

[h1]Art Direction[/h1]

It's safe to say STALKER: SOC only became a cult classic because of its presentation and atmosphere. Mechanics are not the selling point of SOC but are merely there to complement the gritty, eerie, overwhelming feeling it is going for. This is all made clear by its narrative inspiration, [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roadside_Picnic]Roadside Picnic[/url] and [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q3hBLv-HLEc]Tarkovsky's 2 hour Stalker film[/url] based off the book, which has very strong industrial, existential, and human themes to it.

Presenting night and day mechanics alongside impressive shaders that still hold up in 2024, grainy UI, visual overlay effects, and outsanding use of audio samples, SOC is at its best when you take a moment and allow it to speak through its environment.

https://youtu.be/cSNNuE2eiUQ?si=ASehUJ5xpntjUQNB&t=3422

CGI cutscenes for important narrative events also are mesmerizing and look artistically pleasing, specially for the time, and produce themselves only when appropriate for the theme.

[h1]Conclusion [/h1]

STALKER: SOC is an extremely rough diamond eager to scratch you relentlessly if you grip it the wrong way. Regardless, many contemporary games and artwork have since been inspired by its first shine. 

While things tend to be more polished nowadays, STALKER:SOC produced an anomalous impact in gaming culture, so experiencing it first hand is honestly a must if you'd ever like to develop critical outlook for this sort of media. It has good things, it has bad things. It's absolutely not for everyone; many have become lost and crashed in its jank Zone, but those that make it back will understand and appreciate [i]everything[/i] they do get to have a little bit more.

As an addendum; the community for this game is still vibrant, there are many full overhaul mods available that tweak, add, or remove mechanics, and there are DRM free versions of this software at GOG. 

With all that said you could really play this forever, but is that really what you'd wish for?

183615174.review:
Mis impresiones sobre este juego son negativas, no es un desastre y es disfrutable cuando no se bugea,  pero tiene un montón de problemas a nivel de controles, gameplay, diseño e historia. 

Para  jugar este título, tendrás que tener mucha paciencia y tolerancia, se presentan muchas situaciones que se sienten injustas, bugs que te pueden crashear el juego, bugs que rompen la inmersión, posibilidad de quedarte soft-locked. El guardar constantemente se vuelve un obligado en este juego en caso de que te pase alguno de estos malos momentos.

Resumiendo, eres un tío que ha perdido la memoria y te mandan a buscar a un tipo que aparentemente se ha estado cargando gente. El juego es de mundo abierto parcialmente, ya que esta delimitado por zonas. Exploraremos el mundo y haremos misiones como si se tratará de un RPG, pero este juego como tal no es un RPG. Hay mecanicas de Loot, pero tampoco es un juego para dedicarse a lootear... o bueno, si puedes, pero después de varias horas me di cuenta que esto frena feo el ritmo del juego. Mi recomendación es que solo lootees lo que necesites si vas alejarte mucho de un tendero, y si tiene uno cerca, pues llevale todo lo que puedas.

183601245.review: The game’s world is a masterclass in environmental storytelling. The Exclusion Zone is brought to life with stunning realism, from dilapidated Soviet-era buildings to eerie, overgrown forests. The oppressive atmosphere is heightened by dynamic weather systems, day-night cycles, and an ever-present sense of dread. Every corner of the Zone feels alive, filled with mysteries, anomalies, and dangers lurking just out of sight. This isn’t just a backdrop—it’s a character in its own right, forcing players to adapt and react to its ever-changing nature.

183576594.review:
Amazing game.
The horror atmosphere works extremely well when it needs too. 

FPS gameplay becomes fairly solid with main focus on headshots with latter guns but can be somewhat shocking with the nonexistent accuracy of the first few guns you'll get. There is also a fair bit of focus on leaning mechanics and hiding behind cover in fights.

The world itself is very interesting and one of the more unique aspects of the game that I like is that almost everyone has a name making it feel more "real". The game also tries to do something with npcs doing their own thing without the players actions and this succeeds to some degree in making things feel more real but can also make some feel annoying or scripted in a stupid way (one that I disliked was bandit attack on a hangar in Garbage every time I left Agroprom). The good thing is that the main story of your character is somewhat disconnected from the previously mentioned system in a way that feels natural so the death of a npc that was somewhat related to the quest won't softlock you or make things too jank. 

Now on the topic of difficulty. I would call this game easy as long as you use quick saves and manual saves often enough. I would not even consider doing a deathless run in one take but when you can just save mid fight it makes even the fact that you are most of the time one or two headshots away from death not a problem.

This point also affects the exploration. When you explore for the first time and have no idea what certain anomalies do you can just get yourself exploded to smithereens with no real setback aside from few seconds of reload time. Or keep throwing yourself into them until you somehow find just the right angle to get through and get that artifact. This I very much like.

The maps are fairly small which works well with the inability to use fast travel but it also makes artifacts that don't boost stamina recovery less important by default since running out can be annoying.

The story is fairly interesting and characters are pretty believable considering the setting. Voice acting is kinda jank but that gives it even more of a soul imho.

If I had to score it more objectively I would probably give it 7 or 8/10 for the jank but on a personal level it was a 9/10 fun experience that I would recommend to most friends, especially when it's on sale.

Дивне відчуття охоплює мене, коли я проходжу першу частину "Сталкера" — це мій перший досвід з цією грою, хоч до цього вже пройшла "Сталкер 2"... Тепер я розумію, чому всі так люблять ці ігри. Це ніби я повертаюся на стару вулицю з дитинства:  

На заброшці старші діти палять цигарки, і, може, настукають по голові, якщо зазіхнеш на їхній простір. Десь біля пісчаного насипу бігає дворовий пес, який може й вкусити, а за гаражами живе "добрий" дідусь, який завжди пригощає цукерками. На ігровому майданчику інші діти збирають халабуду чи грають у стрілянину з палками... 

Зараз уже нічого такого не залишилося, і слава богу, бо у мене купа шрамів на ногах після тих походів до заброшки, але серйозна гра, така як "Сталкер", дивним чином навіює мені думки про дитинство і старі часи, хоча я вперше запустила цю гру у 2024 році.

183553870.review:
I played a little bit of Anomaly before deciding I wanted to play the original trilogy first, and while this game is noticeable more scuffed and have noticeably worse graphics than anomaly, I'd consider to it to still be a very full gaming experience. The progression in the game is much more clear and straight-forward, with the player going from mission to mission, which I actually prefer to how aimless and blundering Anomaly can be.

Despite the graphics, which aren't exactly amazing, the game can still have some pretty neat environments. My favourite by far is the underground, with some beautiful lighting decisions. The puddles of bubbling green slime add patches of exotic lighting, and the swiveling orange lights which you are greeted with in the starting corridor add some really amazing ambient lighting and audio.

Overall, S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl is an incredibly full gaming experience that was undoubtedly ahead of its time, and shows that it's not about the technology to make an amazing game.

The game just feel clunky, I was able to smooth it out a bit by setting v-sync to Fast, but it's still not great. You die so fast there's not much time to react when you're being shot at. If that sounds fun to you, go for it. I can't recommend it though, very frustrating game.
